message.content:
cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.DS, cs.SY, cs.IT

The paper deals with a variant of the multi-armed bandit problem, which is a classic problem in machine learning and optimization. The paper proposes a Bayesian representation of the solution space and a Thompson Sampling guided algorithm for balancing exploration and exploitation. These techniques are commonly used in the fields of machine learning and artificial intelligence, which suggests that the paper is likely to belong to the cs.LG (Machine Learning) and cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) sub-categories. The paper also deals with optimization and stochastic processes, which are relevant to the cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms) and cs.SY (Systems and Control) sub-categories. Finally, the paper introduces a new algorithm for solving the Stochastic Root Finding (SRF) problem, which is related to information theory and communication, suggesting that the paper may also belong to the cs.IT (Information Theory) sub-category.
